metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1304 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An out-of-bounds read/write vulnerability was found in e2fsprogs 1.46.5. This issue leads to a segmentation fault and possibly arbitrary code execution via a specially crafted filesystem.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1304` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

e2fsck-static - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
e2fslibs - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
e2fsprogs - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
e2fsprogs-l10n - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
fuse2fs - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
libcom-err2 - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
libcomerr2 - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
libext2fs2 - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
libss2 - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
logsave - 1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: e2fsprogs package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.45.5-2ubuntu1.1').
